items.title: Global financial stability risks have not receded, Reserve Bank warns

items.summary: After 36 years working as a house cleaner, Judy Harman needs a knee replacement, but there are hundreds of people in front of her on the wait list for orthopaedic surgery in Canberra.

items.summary: Victim-survivor Katrina Munting says she remains hopeful, but she is concerned the government isn't implementing the commission of inquiry's recommendations quickly enough.

items.summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth summoned hundreds of US military officials to an in-person meeting to declare an end to "woke" culture in the military.

items.title: More sunscreens pulled from shelves over SPF concerns
items.summary: Ten further sunscreens have either been pulled from shelves or "paused" from supply to retailers over concerns about their sun protection claims, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) announces.

items.title: Steven Walker-Ely's murder conviction over footballer's stabbing death set aside
items.summary: An appeal court orders a new trial for Steven Walker-Ely, who was previously convicted of murder and sentenced to life in prison over the stabbing death of a rugby league player in Queensland.

items.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock warns housing supply improvement is likely to be several years away
items.summary: In a rare candid moment, the Reserve Bank governor concedes that, despite the best efforts of policy makers, chronic housing undersupply will continue for at least the next two years.

items.title: Michele Bullock on relationship between interest rates and property prices.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Hundreds gather in Morwell to remember life of 18-year-old Kaiden Morgan
items.summary: Friends and family have gathered in Victoria's east to remember the life of a beloved young man who died in an alleged attack on the weekend.

items.title: Prosecutors seek over 11 years in prison for Sean 'Diddy' Combs as victims deal with nightmares and fear retribution
items.summary: New York prosecutors cite one of Sean "Diddy" Combs accusers who says she lives in fear of his release from detention as the music mogul's case returns to court for sentencing.

items.title: Clean-up underway after 'devastating' industrial spill in Far North Queensland
items.summary: Building company Boral works to clean up thousands of litres of kerosene and bitumen that have spilled into a creek in Cairns, connecting to an inlet that leads to the Great Barrier Reef.

items.title: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban separate after 19 years of marriage
items.summary: A source close to the couple tells the ABC the separation was not a mutual decision, saying it was Urban's decision to leave the relationship.

items.title: Melbourne Storm and Brisbane Broncos name NRL grand finals teams, NRLW teams announced
items.summary: Brisbane Broncos' mid-year recruit Ben Talty has been dropped for this Sunday's NRL grand final, making way for the returning Pat Carrigan.

items.title: Man alleged to have performed Nazi salute minutes after leaving police custody, court hears
items.summary: Tylere Baker-Pearce, 39, was hit with two additional counts of the alleged offence on Monday after being arrested by counterterrorism police outside the Brisbane Magistrates Court.

items.title: Speaking to others without kids helped me find a future after IVF
items.summary: The more people I spoke to, the less frightened I felt of my future. I could shift my focus to what I can do because I don't have a kid, instead of what I was missing out on.

items.title: Australian film industry fears Donald Trump's movie tariff threatens jobs
items.summary: The multi-billion-dollar Australian film industry searches for details after the US president announced he would impose a 100 per cent tariff on movies made outside America.

items.title: West Coast Eagles handed extra draft pick, four rookie list spots to help climb up ladder
items.summary: The West Coast Eagles are handed an extra first-round draft pick and four additional rookie list spots from the AFL, in a bid to help the ailing club return to competitiveness after four dismal years.

items.title: Australia ready to defend Women's Cricket World Cup trophy in India
items.summary: Australia's all-conquering generation of women's cricketers has one last Cricket World Cup feat to tick off, setting their sights on defying almost 40 years of history to win back-to-back ODI tournaments.

items.title: 'Complex' brief of evidence after group charged with stealing crocodile eggs from Kakadu National Park
items.summary: Four men, including a pilot who survived a fatal chopper crash in 2022, are facing Commonwealth charges for allegedly stealing saltwater crocodile eggs from Kakadu National Park.

items.title: Man drowns in Moore River at Guilderton, six swimmers rescued
items.summary: A man in his 30s dies after an incident on the banks of the Moore River in Guilderton, while six other swimmers are rescued by bystanders.

items.title: Geelong is known for its accessibility on Mad Monday, but Bailey Smith's posts have unravelled years of goodwill
items.summary: Geelong forged years of goodwill via its accessibility to Mad Monday — now the club faces a mess that it never saw coming.

items.title: Calls for investigation after thousands of scans may not have been reviewed by doctors at Caboolture Hospital
items.summary: Queensland's premier has called for an independent investigation into the problem, affecting up to 9,000 patients at Caboolture Hospital dating back to April 2023.

items.title: Werribee man found not guilty of deliberately setting neighbour on fire over loud music dispute
items.summary: Michael Gauci, who was accused of setting a neighbour on fire after arguing over loud music, has been found not guilty of attempted murder.

items.title: Donald Day Jr, US conspiracy theorist connected to Wieambilla killers, agrees to watered-down plea deal
items.summary: Donald Day Jr had been in regular online contact with Gareth and Stacey Train before they shot two police officers and a neighbour in December 2022.

items.title: How Brisbane's culture of empowerment has allowed its youngsters to be fearless on the AFL's biggest stage
items.summary: Brisbane's youngest players rise to the occasion on the biggest stage, led by its 21-year-old Norm Smith medallist Will Ashcroft. Here's how the two-time premiers allow their kids to thrive.

items.title: Lily Ridgeway found not guilty of Raymond Terrace manslaughter of Jason Adams
items.summary: Lily Ridgeway, 27, has been found not guilty of manslaughter over the 2020 death of Jason Adams in the NSW Hunter Valley.

items.title: NSW government loses music festival strip search case as woman awarded $93,000 in damages
items.summary: A Sydney woman subjected to an unlawful strip search at a music festival has been awarded $93,000 in damages, in a judgement that could see thousands of others also receive compensation.

items.title: James Turner wins first gold medal for Australia at World Para Athletics Championships
items.summary: Paralympic champion James Turner wins Australia's first gold medal of the World Para Athletics Championships, saluting in the 400m T36 event in Delhi.

items.title: James Tedesco pulls out of Kangaroos selection for Ashes to be best man at brother's wedding
items.summary: Former Kangaroos captain James Tedesco has informed the Australian Rugby League that he will not be available for the upcoming Ashes series in England.

items.title: Optus board expresses 'confidence' in CEO Stephen Rue to lead repair job
items.summary: After it was initially unclear whether Optus and its Singaporean parent company, Singtel, had confidence in chief executive Stephen Rue, the board has confirmed in a statement its support for the embattled CEO to lead the task to restore confidence in Optus.

items.title: Female teacher accused of abusing Sydney boys' school student
items.summary: Police will allege the 24-year-old engaged in an "inappropriate relationship" with a 15-year-old boy in her care.

items.title: Kane Cornes labels Geelong's Mad Monday antics 'disrespectful' and 'embarrassing'
items.summary: Kane Cornes labels Geelong's Mad Monday antics "disrespectful" and "embarrassing", after a slew of social media posts raises eyebrows across the AFL community, including one referencing his Seven colleague Caroline Wilson.

items.title: Glenn Maxwell out of NZ T20 International series after breaking arm
items.summary: A brutal run of injuries continues for one of Australia's top white-ball cricketers, who is out of the T20 series against New Zealand.

items.title: Advocate calls out Kimberley's 'astronomical' fruit and vegetable prices
items.summary: The cost-of-living crisis means fresh produce is more expensive for all Australians, but residents in some remote WA towns are paying up to triple for some items compared to city prices.

items.title: Broncos second-rower Jordan Riki opens up about his quest for redemption in the 2025 NRL grand final
items.summary: After suffering a heartbreaking loss in the 2023 NRL grand final, Jordan Riki says redemption is fuelling Brisbane's journey to the 2025 title.

items.title: A tip cat and a depot duck become invaluable workmates
items.summary: A playful tabby kitten and a ravenous Muscovy duck routinely amuse council staff in their respective workplaces.

items.title: Green carab beetles release tear gas smell in Geraldton while escaping heat
items.summary: Often mistaken for a stink bug or Christmas beetle, this iridescent insect has descended on Geraldton with a tear gas-like odour.

items.title: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold, RBA governor says property market at 'difficult' point — as it happened
items.summary: The Reserve Bank left the cash rate steady at 3.6 per cent at its latest board meeting, as expectations of a November rate cut declined.

items.title: NATO embraces new Australian-made Star Wars-style lasers to counter Russian drones
items.summary: A Canberra-made laser is about to become NATO's newest frontline defence against enemy drones, in a deal experts say could transform the future of warfare.

items.title: Australian-made Apollo laser shoots down drone

items.title: Moorambilla Voices bush choir marks 20 years as former student credits it with saving his life
items.summary: Justin Welsh says joining the Moorambilla Voices children's choir helped steer him away from the challenges that face many young men in small country towns.

items.title: Mitch Brown hits out at Bailey Smith and Patrick Dangerfield over 'homophobic' social media post from Geelong Mad Monday
items.summary: Mitch Brown, the first AFL player to reveal he is bisexual, hits out at Bailey Smith and Patrick Dangerfield over a social media post from Mad Monday.

items.title: Agnes Water hospital plans in limbo as council rejects development approval extension
items.summary: Hundreds of homes targeting the over-50s market are in staged construction on Queensland's central coast, but a council will not grant an extension for hospital plans.

items.title: Will Skelton to return for Wallabies against All Blacks in second Bledisloe Cup Test
items.summary: Lock Will Skelton is set to return for the Wallabies ahead of the final round of the Rugby Championship against the All Blacks.

items.title: Federal environment minister knew of rock art fears before granting Woodside North West Shelf extension
items.summary: The federal environment minister was advised pollution from Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant may be causing irreversible changes to ancient rock art, before granting the company a 40-year extension with strict conditions.

items.title: Rescue founders outraged as kitten Pierre dumped within hours of adoption
items.summary: Just 12 hours after he was adopted, eight-month-old kitten Pierre was found in his carrier in the middle of the road, drenched after an overnight storm. Rescuers are urging owners to de-sex their cats, to help prevent other animals from enduring a similar ordeal.

items.title: First Nations Australians launch class action against Work for the Dole scheme
items.summary: A class action on behalf of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people alleges a Commonwealth Work for the Dole scheme was tougher on remote participants than on jobseekers in cities.

items.title: 'Huge change' to Australia's health system as registered nurses set to prescribe medication
items.summary: Qualified registered nurses will soon be able to write prescriptions for medications, in a bid to ease pressure on a stressed public healthcare system.

items.title: Teenage boys charged over car chase through Melbourne into Bourke Street Mall
items.summary: Police have charged two 16 and 17-year-old boys in relation to a dangerous incident involving an allegedly stolen car being driven into the pedestrian-only Bourke Street Mall.

items.title: Australian homes could soon be built by spider-like robot called Charlotte
items.summary: Developers of a speedy, "spider-like" robot named Charlotte believe it could be building homes on Earth within years, and eventually further lunar exploration.

items.title: Hawthorn Hawks AFLW lose Emily Bates to injury
items.summary: Top-four aspirants Hawthorn are set to lose Emily Bates for the run towards the finals after the star midfielder suffered a shoulder injury.

items.title: Tom Ballard's new show searches for the line between funny and offensive while pushing the comedy envelope
items.summary: Comedian Tom Ballard is swapping a stand-up stage for a dramatic one as his new stage show asks, how do you remember a divisive figure?

items.title: Pro-EU party wins majority in Moldova election in setback for Russia
items.summary: Moscow is accused of attempting to sway the election in favour of a pro-Russian party, but a majority of voters backed the pro-EU Party of Action and Solidarity.

items.title: Consultancy bill to review 'struggling' submarine agency blows out to $12.1 million
items.summary: The agency responsible for delivering AUKUS has spent five times what it first planned for consultants to review its operations.

items.title: Clock is ticking for Optus boss as triple-0 disaster escalates
items.summary: Analysts say the Optus CEO should "leave quietly" now or risk a more public exit once the reviews into the company's recent outages are complete.

items.title: Benjamin Netanyahu agrees to Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan
items.summary: Israel has agreed to a US proposal to end its war on Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump announce after holding talks at the White House.

items.title: Will the Reserve Bank cut interest rates today? Only if hell freezes over
items.summary: With markets pricing next to no chance of an interest rate cut today, what are the chances of another RBA move before year's end?

items.title: US to impose 100pc tariff on movies made outside the country, Trump says
items.summary: US President Donald Trump initially threatened to impose such levies earlier in May but offered few details, leading to confusion among entertainment industry executives.

items.title: Rick Morton's book about Robodebt, Mean Streak, among Prime Minister's Literary Award winners
items.summary: Journalist Rick Morton didn't want to write a book about Robodebt. Now that book, Mean Streak, has won the Prime Minister's Literary Award for non-fiction.

items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Albanese invites Emirati retail giant Lulu Hypermarket to take on Coles and Woolworths
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has invited Emirati 'hypermarket' chain LuLu Group to set up shop on Australia's shores and take on supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths.

items.title: James Tedesco is named best NRL player by his peers for the fourth time despite Roosters falling short in NRL finals
items.summary: The 32-year-old fullback joins Johnathan Thurston as the only four-time winner of the players' champion award, after the Sydney Roosters star was voted the NRL's best player of 2025 by his peers.

items.title: Climate change is hitting the Northern Territory harder than most places in Australia
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: At least 13 dead after Typhoon Bualoi makes landfall in Vietnam
items.summary: At least 13 people have died after heavy rain and strong winds from the former Typhoon Bualoi flooded roads, knocked off roofs in central Vietnam, state media reported, with residents describing it as "one of the strongest".

items.title: Body scanner to be used in ACT courts after significantly reducing prison strip searches
items.summary: The ACT government will expand the use of electronic body scanners to the courts after their use in Canberra's only prison saw a dramatic drop in the need to strip search prisoners.

items.title: Young father caught allegedly flying drone into Canberra prison to drop drugs
items.summary: Police allege the the man was trying to deliver drugs, nicotine patches, USB sticks and a smart watch to prisoners inside a Canberra jail.

items.title: India claim they were denied Asia Cup trophy after win over Pakistan
items.summary: India T20 skipper Suryakumar Yadav has claimed that his team was denied the chance to lift the 2025 Asia Cup trophy, after it beat Pakistan in the final by five wickets on Sunday.

items.title: How can we better prepare tourists at Cradle Mountain?
items.summary: Cradle Mountain is one of Tasmania's most popular, and dangerous, tourism destinations. After another tragedy, questions are asked about what more could be done to ensure the safety of visitors.

items.title: Kylie Soanes is an urban ecologist on a mission to prove nature belongs in our cities
items.summary: Kylie Soanes says urban development should not come at the expense of nature and there's no reason why we should not spot a fairy wren on the way to the bus stop.
